title: Ali the Camel

properties.name: description
properties.value: Ali the Camels are two camels sharing the same name in a pasture in the middle of Pollnivneach. These camels are important in quests due to their dung which a player can achieve via pouring red hot sauce into their trough.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Jasim the Camel
Not to be confused with Alice the Camel.
Ali the Camel
Released4 April 2005 (Update)
MembersYes
RaceCamel
LocationPollnivneach
Quest• The Feud
• My Arm's Big Adventure
OptionsPet
ExamineA foul tempered ugly lumpy yellow horse prone to spitting.
Map
Advanced data
NPC ID3543

Ali the Camels are two camels sharing the same name in a pasture in the middle of Pollnivneach. These camels are important in quests due to their dung which a player can achieve via pouring red hot sauce into their trough.

They can be found in a pen near the Camel Trader. They are rather bad tempered and will attempt to kick you if you insult them.

If you try to pet them your character will have one of three responses. One is "That beast would probably bite my fingers off if I tried to pet it" another is "I'm not going to pet that! I might get fleas or something else that nasty creature might have." and the last is "Mmmm... Won't you make the nicest kebab?" which is paired by an expression that your character pulls. The camels will respond to the player if they are wearing a camulet.
